column1: Jimmy's papa has about a hundred horses
column3: and a great many hundred sheep. He does not keep them in barns
column5: but they roam over the hills
column6: and feed on grass both in winter and summer.Mr. Mason's house is five miles from any neighbor
column7: and fifteen miles from town. There is no garden or fence round it
column8: and there are no trees to be seen anywhere near. But there are wild flowers in abundance. One of them is a species of cactus. It bears beautiful yellow blossoms in summer
column11: not good to eat. Another kind of cactus has crimson and scarlet blossoms
column12: but no prickly pears.Both of these plants are covered with sharp thorns and prickles. Jimmy thinks the blossoms are pretty; but he does not like to pick them.
